title: Bontexkenzy
author: Bontexkenzy
content: Nigeria is democratic state with a presidential system of of government theoretically.while  in practice,it is unitary state with autocratic system of government.  Nigeria, can't be called a democratic nation, while none of the pillers of of democracy are not followed.1_some individuals are above the law, which alter it's supremacy.2_The people mandate is not heard.3_The president has too much veto power,he control both the the judiciary and legislature4_There is not check and balance5_ Two party system in practice,PDP and APC are one in practice and the remaining parties are one.north vs the rest of Nigeria6_protection of the lives and properties of the masses is not longer a function of the government6_curruption is legalized in practice7_fusion of power, the president is vice president,inec chairman, chief justice of the federation, the ministers,Senate president, controlling the military etc.becaise he put them there.8_The constitution is not supreme and flexible9_devision of the country through ethnicity, tribalism, religious line10_Detachment of the masses from political activities in the country.    Therefore, Nigeria practice democracy on paper not practically

comments.author: Mr.right85
comments.body: Quote from: Bontexkenzy on July 02, 2022, 01:28:35 AMNigeriaI guess its not the only corrupt country on the face of the planet. There are several countries that are corrupt out there and still they get to say very little of it. Speaking of South Sudan, Somalia, North Korea, Pakistan, Paraguay and many others. Somehow, these guys aren't very shouty about it and you wonder if they are not on the forum or aren't plagued by the menace of these corrupt practices in there nation states.I understand at OP that, being constantly under the hit from the unjust acts and policies that emerges from the corrupt governance seems like a lot to you but in turn, what are you doing for a change. Its time again to select a new leader to head the highest office in the nation come 2023. I know its been so bad that Nigerians no longer believe in the electoral process as, its often rigged but I'll beacon on you to go get your permanent voters card (PVC), come out with the masses and vote in a peaceful election.Dont just vote and leave, wait till the results for your pooling unit is announced and if possible tap it and be justified that you've done your best before going about to being a good citizen of this great nation. The change is now and it starts with you!

comments.author: BADecker
comments.body: There might be a form of Democracy that works right for the people. But it isn't being used in any major nation.All that Democracy does is to elect a dictator, or a dictatorial group. The Dictatorial government goes out and does whatever it wants.The US isn't a Democracy. Only the US Government is. The rest of the US is a Republic... freedom for the people.Is it the same for any place in Nigeria? Or are all the people included in the Nigerian Democracy, and none of them in a Republic?

comments.author: Lordhermes
comments.body: Democracy has been the political system of Nigeria,and any government coming into seat must adopt the pattern that has been used by his successors in order to maintain a smooth political tenure.Democracy is indeed the best for Nigeria because Nigerian politics is always full of problems and bribery,therefore,in order to continue a smooth political system that will be free of curruption and bribery,the government of the people,by the people,and for the people will be used.A situation whereby people will be given the privilege to choose who ever they like to rule them.It is the very best for Nigeria and they have been maintaining it.

comments.author: Yawa2020
comments.body: The term democracy itself is a mere fabrication that it is not realistic in real sense. No where in the world where democracy is being practiced including America. To some scholars e.g Aristotle doesn't believe in the existence of democracy as a system of government simply because it is not practicable based on what it preaches. It is just Nigeria and most of many other African countries tend to abuse power and have no regards to the constitution and democracy they practiced. Although democracy offers fair system of government despite its lapses after all.

comments.author: teosanru
comments.body: The pointers that you have mentioned Clearly indicate that it is not a democracy at all, the most important point in democracy is that Judiciary is an entirely independent pillar from the government and government or any executive cannot veto what the judiciary has decided for once. Best they can do is to change the law for future instances if they want to but that too shouldn't alter the very essence of the constitution. So constitution should always be supreme and not easily alterable for major laws.
